questions.question: Rahul is known for his ................................. fuse. The other day he yelled at the teacher for asking him to leave the class.
questions.description: To have a short fuse is to have quick temper.

questions.question: I had ........................................ in my stomach as I waited for the results to be announced.
questions.description: When you have butterflies in your stomach, you are nervous.

questions.question: Peter made the national team by the skin of his ................................... you can tell that he hasn't fully recovered from his injuries.
questions.description: When you make something by the skin of your teeth, you barely make it.

questions.question: If you always cry ................................., no one will be there to help you when you actually need it.
questions.description: To cry wolf is to ask for help when you don't need it.

questions.question: Cut him some ................................ After all, he is a mere child.
questions.description: To cut someone some slack is to not judge them too harshly.

questions.question: I didn't go to the party because I was down for the .................................. after working all day in the garden.
questions.description: When you are down for the count, you are too tired.

questions.question: I know getting fired is no fun but remember that every cloud has a ....................................... lining.
questions.description: This expression is used to mean that you can find good in every bad situation.

questions.question: Finding a good job these days is as hard as finding a ............................................... in a haystack.
questions.description: This expression is used to refer to something that is virtually impossible.

questions.question: I felt like a ...................................... out of water at the party because I didn't know anyone there.
questions.description: To feel like a fish out of water is to feel out of place.

questions.question: I have to get this off my ……………………………… - I was the person who reported you to the police.
questions.description: To get something off your chest is to talk about something that has been bothering you for a while.

questions.question: I have never gone scuba diving, but I am going to give it a ....................................
questions.description: To give it a whirl is to try something.

questions.question: Her career went down in .................................... after she started doing drugs.
questions.description: To go down in flames is to fail suddenly and spectacularly.
